text: Yo! I’ve got some info and questions for y’all about the head start robotics classes in  a couple weeks

elements.text: Yo! I’ve got some info and questions for y’all about the head start robotics classes in  a couple weeks

text: is this about the volunteer thing or smth else?

elements.text: is this about the volunteer thing or smth else?

text:
We need to figure out what the plan is. I’ve narrowed it down to three or so options. We could:
• Have the students build a small cardboard robotic hand powered by a servo and the pi, like this: <https://www.birdbraintechnologies.com/hummingbirdduo/projects/making-a-robot-hand-with-hummingbird/|https://www.birdbraintechnologies.com/hummingbirdduo/projects/making-a-robot-hand-with-hummingbird/>
• Re-use an upgraded version of the gear up curriculum (<@U022WGTQ602>, <@U01CZUZA4F3> y’all let me know if you think that’s a good way to teach the pi’s)
• Give each student a 3D printed robotic car and teach them how to send commands over WiFi to it and do basic auto navigation with sensors. If y’all really like that I need to know ASAP since it’s a lot more prep
I need as many of y’all to help volunteer a possible, probably only a couple of days per week. I’m going to work with <@U0119239VCY> and <@U018WC9RM3K> to prepare all the coursework beforehand so it won’t take too much work from y'all

attachments.title: Making a Robot Hand with Hummingbird - BirdBrain Technologies
attachments.text: You can use the servo motor for more than just rotating something from 0° to 180°! This tutorial will show you how to use cardboard, straws, and yarn to create a robot hand. Then you will use a servo motor to pull on the yarn so that the fingers bend. The first part of this …
attachments.fallback: BirdBrain Technologies: Making a Robot Hand with Hummingbird - BirdBrain Technologies

text: Yes

elements.text: Yes

text: <!everyone>
I would probably say do the pi stuff or attempt to the the car because the robotic hand looks relatively easy and I'm afraid we would get done with it before the week(s) are over
